cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast today, then expected to bend westward and approach the central-upper Texas coast late Sunday into Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda Bay–Port O’Connor area

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf Coast from Louisiana westward to northeastern Mexico, especially the Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible beginning late Sunday and persisting into Monday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could drive 2–4 ft of surge above ground level along the mid-Texas coast, including Freeport, late Sunday through Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Slow movement may produce 4–8 inches of rain with isolated higher totals, causing freshwater flooding concerns at and near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents expected along the upper Texas coast throughout the weekend.
